results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Missiles and Missile Defense Systems;Japan;North Korea
results.byline: By Choe Sang-Hun and Motoko Rich
results.title: North Korea Fires Missile Over Japan in Major Escalation
results.abstract: The missile flew about 2,800 miles, the longest distance ever traveled by a North Korean missile, officials in Tokyo and Seoul said.

media.caption: A screen displaying news reporting of North Korea’s launch of a ballistic missile, in Tokyo, Japan, on Tuesday. North Korea launched a ballistic missile over Japan that landed in the Pacific Ocean, the exclusive economic zone (EEZ) of Japan, about 3000km east of Japan.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Chemistry;Tests and Examinations;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Medical Schools;Jones, Maitland Jr;New York University
results.title: At N.Y.U., Students Were Failing Organic Chemistry. Who Was to Blame?
results.abstract: Maitland Jones Jr., a respected professor, defended his standards. But students started a petition, and the university dismissed him.

media.caption: Students said Maitland Jones’s course was too hard and blamed him and his teaching methods for their poor showings.
media.copyright: Janice Chung for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.abstract: Meet the young Japanese who have decided to live in a shoe box.

results.byline: By Edgar Sandoval, Miriam Jordan, Patricia Mazzei and J. David Goodman
results.title: The Story Behind DeSantis’s Migrant Flights to Martha’s Vineyard
results.abstract: Asylum seekers in Texas were recruited for the flights by a woman who appeared to be a former Army counterintelligence agent. “We were tricked,” one migrant said.

media.caption: A group of men from Venezuela outside the Migrant Resource Center in San Antonio in September.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Mixed Martial Arts;Medical Marijuana;Theodorou, Elias;Ultimate Fighting Championship
results.title: Elias Theodorou, Pioneer of Medical Marijuana in Sports, Dies at 34
results.abstract: A Canadian mixed martial artist, he brought cerebral flair to the ring and a dogged determination to his campaign for changing the sport’s drug rules.

media.caption: Elias Theodorou, right, in 2018 in a middleweight mixed martial arts bout with Eryk Anders of the United States in Toronto. He was already a widely admired sports figure when he took up the cause of medical marijuana.

results.adx_keywords: Soccer;Sexual Harassment;Riley, Paul (1963- );National Women's Soccer League (US);Portland Thorns (Soccer Team);United States Soccer Federation;United States Women's National Soccer Team
results.title: Report Details ‘Systemic’ Abuse of Players in Women’s Soccer
results.abstract: A yearlong investigation found U.S. Soccer executives, N.W.S.L. owners and coaches at all levels of American soccer had turned a blind eye toward years of reports of abuse from players.
org_facet: United States Women's National Soccer Team

media.caption: The Portland Thorns and Houston Dash paused their match last October to honor sexual abuse survivors and protest the league’s handling of complaints.
media.copyright: Soobum Im/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

results.title: Nobel Prize Awarded to Scientist Who Sequenced Neanderthal Genome
results.abstract: Svante Pääbo, a Swedish geneticist, was honored for work that created a new field of ancient DNA studies and identified populations at higher risk of disease.

results.title: Fishing Contest Rocked by Cheating Charges After Weights Found in Winning Catches
results.abstract: Two competitors stuffed walleye with lead balls in a scheme that was caught after the tournament director and attendees grew suspicious.

media.caption: A walleye taken from Lake Erie near Marblehead, Ohio.

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Polls and Public Opinion;California;Marin County (Calif)
results.title: Once Known for Vaccine Skeptics, Marin Now Tells Them ‘You’re Not Welcome’
results.abstract: The wealthy California county just north of San Francisco has one of the nation’s highest Covid-19 vaccination rates after years of being known for parents who opposed shots for childhood diseases.

media.caption: Karen Casas, 4, of Marin County receiving her first Covid-19 vaccine.

results.title: ‘Bros’ Fails at the Box Office, as ‘Smile’ Arrives at No. 1
results.abstract: Promoted as the first gay romantic comedy from a major studio, “Bros” sold $4.8 million in tickets, about 40 percent less than expected.

media.caption: Luke Macfarlane and Billy Eichner in “Bros,” which was embraced by critics but arrived in fourth place at the box office.

results.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Season 1, Episode 7 Recap: An Ugly Game
results.abstract: This week’s episode wove an enormous amount of objectively bonkers goings-on into a mostly credible hour of drama, with one big exception.

media.caption: What’s worse than a Westeros wedding? A Westeros funeral. From left: Olivia Cooke, Paddy Considine, Evie Allen, Steve Toussaint, Eve Best and Shani Smethurst in “House of the Dragon.”

results.byline: By Rebecca Halleck and Audra D. S. Burch
results.title: Strange Scenes of Ian: From a Doorbell Camera
results.abstract: Many people saw glimpses of the storm’s impact on their homes through their phones.

results.title: ‘I Did All I Could’: As Floodwaters Rose, She Fought to Save Her Disabled Brothers
results.abstract: Darcy Bishop for decades has cared for her two brothers, who have cerebral palsy. Hurricane Ian was her biggest test yet.

media.caption: Darcy Bishop cleaned up her home after it flooded from Hurricane Ian in Naples, Fla.
media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.title: Sacheen Littlefeather, Activist Who Rejected Brando’s Oscar, Dies at 75
results.abstract: The actress was booed at the Academy Awards in 1973 after she refused the best actor award on Marlon Brando’s behalf in protest of Hollywood’s depictions of Native Americans.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

media.caption: Ms. Littlefeather with the speech she began delivering but never finished at the Oscars ceremony in 1973. She and Mr. Brando had become friends through her neighbor the director Francis Ford Coppola.

results.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad
results.title: Russia’s Small Nuclear Arms: A Risky Option for Putin and Ukraine Alike
results.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has 2,000 small nuclear weapons, but their utility on the battlefield may not be worth the longer-term costs.

media.caption: The atomic threats of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia may come as a shock to Americans who have barely thought about nuclear arms in recent decades.
